Name: Rooftop solar
Text: Install 100 square meters of solar panels on the hotel's roof.
Feedback: The solar panels are generating electricity. This year, the purchase of the panels is adding to emissions from purchasing. Customers like to look of them.

Name: LED lighting
Text: Replace old lightbulbs with LED lighting.
Feedback: With the LED lights, electricity from lighting is down by 50%.

Name: Electric shuttle vehicles
Text: Replace the fleet of 5 cars with electric shuttle buses. Depreciation expense is up.
Feedback: Purchasing the new shuttle buses has increased emissions from purchasing. Petrol consumption is replaced by electricity, with a small impact on annual emissions. Customers like the idea of being driven in a 'green car'.

Name: Electricity generating gym bikes
Text: Place bikes in the gym that generate electricity when guests use them.
Feedback: The bikes in the gym are not having much impact

Name: Upgrade Air Conditioning
Text: Replace the existing air conditioning with a state-of-the-art system.
Feedback: The new air conditioners are much more efficient and electricity consumption is down.

Name: Insulate windows
Text: Addan insulating layer to all windows.
Feedback: Insulating the windows is helping to reduce energy from heating and airco.

Name: New kitchen equipment
Text: Install new kitchen equipment to cut energy consumption.
Feedback: The new kitchen equipment is saving electricity and water.

Name: Smart climate control system
Text: Implement climate control to make heating and airconditioning are off in empty rooms.
Feedback: The climate control system is a great and simple way to save energy .

Name: Remove minibars
Text: Remove (and recycle) minibars to save electricity consumption.
Feedback: There is no more revenue from minibars, but some of it has been replaced with revenue in the lobby bar. Staff don't need to spend time refilling the minibars and electricity consumption is down a bit.

Name: Light sensors
Text: Add light sensors so lights are off when corridors are empty.
Feedback: The new sensors are helping to cut electricity consumption from lighting.

Name: Revolving doors
Text: Replace sliding doors with revolving ones to manage temperature in lobby.
Feedback: The revolving doors are keeping the temperature more constant in the lobby.

Name: Water efficient appliances
Text: Change all showerheads and water taps.
Feedback: Water consumption has dropped by over 20,000 liters per day.

Name: Refillabe soap bottles
Text: Replace disposable soap with refillable bottles.
Feedback: Customers did not compain about the refillable shampoo bottles. Most hotels have this already.

Name: Organic cotton bed linen
Text: Purchase organic sheets when replacing bed linen.
Feedback: Customers like the idea of organic bed linen, but the impact on your Scope 3 emissions is quite small and costs are up a bit.

Name: Low carbon furniture
Text: Partner with local low carbon furniture supplier for beds and chairs.
Feedback: The new furniture supplier is helping to reduce Scope 3 emissions, at a small additional cost

Name: Eco-friendly cleaning materials
Text: Use cleaning materials that are chemical free.
Feedback: Switching to chemical free cleaning products has many environmental & health benefits, but it has little impact on emissions.

Name: Expand vegetarian menu
Text: Add vegetarian items to the menu and promote them in the hotel's restaurant.
Feedback: Customers like the vegetarian options and the reduction in meat consumption is reducing Scope 3 emissions from food.

Name: Expand organic food menu
Text: Add organic items to the menu and promote them in the hotel's restaurant.
Feedback: The organic menu items are popular, but don't have a big impact on emissions.

Name: Low carbon carpets
Text: Carpets need replacement and a new,local supplier offers a sustainable option.
Feedback: The new carpets have much lower embodied carbon and Scope 3 emission have gone down.

Name: Eliminate plastic bottles
Text: Get rid of plastic bottles and serve filtered tap water in glass bottles or jugs.
Feedback: Getting rid of plastic bottles has made customers happier. There is less waste and a small impact on emissions from purchasing.

Name: Recruit Sustainability Officer
Text: Use the services of an inhouse expert to drive sustainability efforts.
Feedback: The Sustainability Officer is driving change. Small improvements are made across the hotel and staff is more aware of the need to reduce emissions.

Name: Food composting
Text: Recycle food waste into compost in the hotel's garden.
Feedback: Guests are impressed with the new composting facility and food waste is down.

Name: Recycling bins in rooms
Text: Place three bins in every room to segregate waste and recycle.
Feedback: Guests are using the recycling bins, leading to less waste going to landfill.

Name: Go paperless
Text: Send bills to customers by email (unless requested).
Feedback: Paper use has gone down to nearly zero. Guests said they prefer to receive their receipts by email.

Name: Free parking for EVs
Text: Allow customers with Electric Vehicles to park for free.
Feedback: The hotel's emissions don't include those from the cars of guests, so unfortunately encouraging them to use EVs has no impact on your emissions.

Name: Adjust temperature
Text: Increase temperature in summer and decrease it in winter.
Feedback: Changing the temperature in the common spaces is a simple measure with a big impact.

Name: Publish sustainability report
Text: Partner with consultants to produce an annual sustainability report.
Feedback: The sustainability report has been well received, but by itself it has no impact on emissions.

Name: Get sustainability rating
Text: Obtain industry-wide sustainability rating and publicise the results.
Feedback: Customers appreciate the hotel's sustainability rating, but there is no change in emissions.

Name: Electronics recycling
Text: Partner with local company and donate old TVs, fridges and other equipment to them.
Feedback: Donating electronic waste is great for the environment, but the impact on emissions is moderate.

Name: Plant trees
Text: Plant 50 trees in the hotels garden to help clean the air and capture carbon.
Feedback: Guests like the added greenery, but the carbon they absorb hardly registers. When fully grown, 50 trees will absorb only around 1 tonne per year.

Name: Double parking charges
Text: Encourage public transport by doubling parking charges for guests.
Feedback: Encouraging public transport is good, but does not impact the hotel's Scope 3 emissions (since these are not included in the baseline measurement).

Name: Renewable energy from grid
Text: Purchase 1 million kWh renewable energy from the grid, at a 10% price premium.
Feedback: Purchasing renewable energy has a big impact on emissions, even though it comes at a premium.

Name: Fix water leaks
Text: Commission plumbing experts to identify and fix water leaks throughout the hotel.
Feedback: Water leaks are fixed and water consumption has gone down by 1 million liters per year. The impact on emissions is modest.

Name: Green roof
Text: Planting grass and vegetation on the roof to absorb carbon and provide insulation.
Feedback: The green roof is improving insulation and air quality.

Name: Add plants in lobby
Text: Adding plants in the lobby will freshen the air and absorb some carbon.
Feedback: The plants look nice in the lobby and air quality has improved, but there is very little absorption of carbon.

Name: Management Performance Indicators
Text: Incorporate emission reduction targets in performance measures for all managers.
Feedback: The new performance measures are making managers focus much more on energy efficiency and emissions reduction.

Name: Local purchasing
Text: Ensure at least half of purchasing budget is spent with local suppliers.
Feedback: Using local suppliers is reducing Scope 3 emissions from transport, but more can be done to select low carbon suppliers.

Name: Make bicycles available
Text: Allow guests to use bycicles free of charge to avoid use of taxis and cars.
Feedback: Guests like the bikes, but they don't help the hotel to reduce emissions.

Name: Upgrade website
Text: Communicate about sustainability achievements on hotel website
Feedback: The new website is helping to attract a few more sustainability conscious customers, but is impacting customer behavior much.

Name: Outsource laundry
Text: Partner with sustainable laundry company and donate existing washing machines to recycling center.
Feedback: Outsourcing the laundy has increased Scope 3 emissions, but reduced the hotel's electricty consumption and leading to a reduction in emissions overall.

Name: Energy efficiency training
Text: Train all staff on the importance of energy saving and emissions reduction.
Feedback: Training staff has had a big impact on behaviour, reducing consumption of energy and water, and reducing waste.

Name: Train purchasing team
Text: Train purchasing team on sustainable procurement.
Feedback: Training the purchasing team has helped to change procuement practices and Scope 3 emissions

Name: Guest communication
Text: Place signs with energy and water saving tips in every room.
Feedback: Communicating with guests has encouraged them to save energy and water.

Name: Offsets
Text: Buy offset certificates to finance emissions avoidance projects outside the hotel.
Feedback: Even if the offsets are credible and certified, according to the Science Based Targets Initiative they can't be counted as an emissions reduction.

Name: Guest rewards
Text: Give guests loyalty points based on their energy and water consumption.
Feedback: The loyalty points are incrasing the sustainability awareness of guests and is impacting behavior.

Name: Backup microgrid
Text: Install a solar powered backup microgrid to supply electricity in case of a power outage.
Feedback: The backup microgrid is making the hotel more resilient, but is not directly reducing emissions.

Name: Vegetable garden
Text: Grow own vegetables in greenhouse in hotel garden and serve them in he restaurants.
Feedback: Guests love the greens from the garden. Scope 3 emissions are down slightly.

Name: Dry car wash
Text: Buy materials that enable the hotel's cars to be washed without water.
Feedback: Water consumption from car washes is down, but the overall impact is small.

Name: Work from home
Text: Allow admin staff to work from home 3 days a week.
Feedback: Electricity consumption in the office is down slightly, but since staff travel has not been counted in Scope 3 there is no other impact

Name: Internal carbon pricing
Text: Add internal price of carbon ($50 per kg) to budgets for all departments
Feedback: The internal carbon price is making all departments more aware of the cost of carbon and is resulting in emission reductions across the board.

Name: Drones for luggage transport
Text: Use drones to take luggage of guests to their rooms.
Feedback: The drones are resulting in a slight reduction in staff costs, but there is no impact on emissions.

Name: Chatbots
Text: Let all hotel phones be anwered by chatbots and only refer to humans if needed.
Feedback: The chatbots are now working well, but they are not leading to an emissions reduction.

Name: Recylced linen
Text: Sheets and towels from recylced cotton have now become cost competitive.
Feedback: The recycled linen is helping to cut emissions from purchasing, at no additional cost.

Name: Carbon tracker
Text: Provide guests with real-time emissions data and personalized sustainability recommendations throughout their stay to their smart device.
Feedback: Guests appreciate the carbon trackers and are using the tips to reduce emissions.

Name: Cultivated meat
Text: Replace all meat and fish products in restaurants with plant based and cultivated meat alternatives.

Name: Carbon capture for guests
Text: Install a new carbon capture device on the roof.

Name: Ultra efficient lights
Text: Replace lighting with very low energy consumption lightbulbs

Name: Solar powered vertical farm
Text: Produce all fruits and vegetables for the restaurants in solar powered vertical farm in hotel yard. Show new farm to guests for educational and marketing purposes.

Name: AI building management system
Text: AI powered building management system to reduce energy an water consumption.

Name: AI energy audit
Text: Use AI for automated energy audit and implement suggestions.

Name: Robots in restaurant
Text: Replace staff in restuarants with robots to prepare and serve food.

Name: Self driving shuttle
Text: Level 4 autonomous driving is now available for the otel shuttles
Feedback: Wth Level 4 autonomy, a human still needs to be behind the wheel in case of emergencies. In any case, there has been no change in emissions.

Name: AI Procurement system
Text: Use AI to identify and select sustainable suppliers

Name: 3D Printing of souvenirs
Text: Personalized 3D printed souvenirs in gift shop
Feedback: The 3D printing is leading to a small increase in energy consumption and a minor reduction in emissions from purchasing.

Name: Carbon pricing for guests
Text: Reduce base room rates and make guests pay $50 per kg of carbon emissions during their stay. The new system is designed so it does not lead to additional costs or revenues.
Feedback: The carbon price for guests is making guests reduce their energy consumption, although some complain that they feel they are now paying extra for electricity.
